channel.title: Retro on Chris Bracken
channel.description: Recent content in Retro on Chris Bracken

item.title: PR#6
item.description: According to Slashdot, this month the Apple II turns 30. It was in production for 18 of those 30 years, which likely makes it the longest-selling personal computer of all time. It was the computer I wrote my first program on, and spent countless hours banging in and editing code from Compute magazineâ€”including page after page of raw hex code when a program included graphics.
